name: HD 62509
scenarioDescription:
The HD 62509 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 62509 is a star with 2.1 times the mass of the Sun, and 8.31 times its radius. It is located 33.72 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.98 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 62509 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 62509 system


HD 62509 b

HD 62509 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.64 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 62509 b is 731.4 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 62509 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 62509, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
